text: Pierre Mignot (born February 23, 1944 in Montreal, Quebec) is a Canadian cinematographer. He is a four-time Canadian Film Award and Genie Award winner for Best Cinematography, winning at the 28th Canadian Film Awards in 1977 for J.A. Martin Photographer (J.A. Martin photographe), at the 5th Genie Awards in 1984 for Maria Chapdelaine, at the 6th Genie Awards in 1985 for Mario and at the 8th Genie Awards in 1987 for Anne Trister.Wyndham Wise, Take One's Essential Guide to Canadian Film. University of Toronto Press, 2001. . He was also nominated in 1980 for Cordélia, in 1983 for A Day in a Taxi (Une journée en taxi), in 1987 for Exit, in 1989 for Straight for the Heart (À corps perdu), in 1990 for Cruising Bar, in 1992 for Phantom Life (La vie fantôme), in 1999 for Alegría, in 2004 for Bittersweet Memories (Ma vie en cinémascope) and in 2005 for C.R.A.Z.Y.. ==References== ==External links== * Category:1944 births Category:Canadian cinematographers Category:People from Montreal Category:Best Cinematography Genie and Canadian Screen Award winners Category:Living people Category:Prix Albert-Tessier winners
